newsitem.title: GERMANY: Badenwerk plans share split via merger.
newsitem.headline: Badenwerk plans share split via merger.

text.p: German utility Badenwerk AG said on Wednesday it would carry out a share split in the course of its planned merger with electricity provider Energie-Versorgung Schwaben.
Badenwerk said in a regulatory news release that holders of existing 50-mark ($28.96) nominal shares would receive 10 five-mark nominal shares in the merged company.
The same ratio would apply to Badenwerk preference shares.

Holders of 250-mark nominal EVS shares would receive 78 ordinary shares in the merged company plus a cash payment of 46.83 marks. Owners of 1,000-mark nominal EVS shares would get 315 new shares and a cash payment of 23.02 marks per share.
Badenwerk said that its main shareholders agreed at a meeting on Wednesday to support the merger at its annual shareholders' meeting on August 20.
